bibl.title: A Second-Century Greek Ephemeris for Venus.
bibl.note: P. Dublin Inv. TCD Pap. F 7 [ed.: Francisca A.J. HOOGENDIJK, Fragment of a Greek Planetary Table, ZPE 48 (1982) pp. 135-141 et pl. VI]. Proposes a reconstruction of the pattern of motion assumed for Venus and relates it to various schemes for predicting Venus's motion in Babylonian astronomical texts.
JONES Alexander, A Second-Century Greek Ephemeris for Venus.
